intro: Ceratostema emarginatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed starwort, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features slender, upright stems that bear small, clustered flowers with five narrow, pointed lobes. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It typically blooms in late summer, producing delicate white or pale pink flowers. Ceratostema emarginatum is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often growing in alpine or subalpine environments.
